props.summary:
Here’s a structured summary of the **core topics, concepts, principles, and equations** essential for the **"Modern Application Development I"** exam, along with **Mermaid knowledge graphs** to visualize relationships. --- --- ### **1. Core Topics & Concepts** #### **A. Flask (Python Web Framework)** 1. **Routing & Views** - `@app.route()` decorator for defining endpoints. - Dynamic URLs (e.g., `/`). - Trailing slash behavior (e.g., `/about` vs `/about/`). - HTTP methods (`GET`, `POST`, `PUT`, `DELETE`). - **Key Code Snippets:** ```python @app.route('/user/') def show_user(user_id): return f"User ID: {user_id}" ``` 2. **Request Handling** - Accessing query parameters (`request.args`). - Form data (`request.form`). - JSON data (`request.json`). - **Example:** ```python name = request.args.get('name', default='Guest') ``` 3. **Templates (Jinja2)** - Template inheritance (`{% extends %}`, `{% block %}`). - Variable rendering (`{{ variable }}`). - Conditional logic (`{% if %}`). - **Example:** ```html {% extends "base.html" %} {% block content %}

{{ title }}

{% endblock %} ``` 4. **Error Handling** - `abort()` for HTTP errors (e.g., `404`, `400`). - Custom error pages (`@app.errorhandler`). - **Example:** ```python abort(404, description="Resource not found") ``` 5. **Flask-RESTful** - Resource-based routing (`api.add_resource()`). - Request parsing (`reqparse.RequestParser`). - **Example:** ```python parser = reqparse.RequestParser() parser.add_argument('name', required=True) ``` 6. **Database Integration (SQLAlchemy)** - ORM basics (`db.Model`, `db.Column`, `db.relationship`). - Querying (`filter_by`, `first`, `all`). - Cascading deletes (`cascade="all, delete"`). - Lazy loading (`lazy='dynamic'` returns a query object). - **Example:** ```python class User(db.Model): id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True) posts = db.relationship('Post', lazy='dynamic') ``` 7. **Flask-SQLAlchemy Relationships** - One-to-Many, Many-to-Many. - Foreign keys (`db.ForeignKey`). - Backreferences (`backref`). - **Example:** ```python class Post(db.Model): user_id = db.Column(db.Integer, db.ForeignKey('user.id')) ``` --- #### **B. Frontend Development** 1. **HTML/CSS** - Block vs. inline elements (`
` vs ``). - CSS styling (`border`, `font-weight`, `background-color`). - **Example:** ```css #mybox { border: 1px solid black; background-color: orange; } ``` 2. **JavaScript** - DOM manipulation (`document.getElementById`). - Event handling (`onclick`). - **Example:** ```javascript function doSomething() { document.getElementById("txt1").style.fontWeight = "bold"; } ``` --- #### **C. Git & Version Control** 1. **Basic Commands** - `git add`, `git commit`, `git push`, `git pull`. - Branching (`git branch`, `git checkout`, `git merge`). - **Example Workflow:** ```bash git checkout main git merge feature-branch ``` 2. **Conflict Resolution** - Handling merge conflicts. - **Key Principle:** Always `pull` before `push` to avoid conflicts. --- #### **D. Testing** 1. **Unit Testing (pytest)** - Test functions must start with `test_`. - Assertions (`assert`). - Fixtures for setup/teardown. - **Example:** ```python def test_addition(): assert add(2, 3) == 5 ``` 2. **Markers & Selective Testing** - `@pytest.mark.unit`, `@pytest.mark.integration`. - Running specific tests: ```bash pytest -m "unit and not slow" ``` 3. **Flask Testing** - `Flask.test_client()` for route testing. - **Example:** ```python def test_home_page(client): response = client.get('/') assert response.status_code == 200 ``` --- #### **E. HTTP & Web Concepts** 1. **HTTP Methods** - `GET` (idempotent, data in URL). - `POST` (data in body, not cached). - **Why avoid `GET` for sensitive data?** URLs are logged in browser history. 2. **Status Codes** - `200 OK`, `201 Created`, `400 Bad Request`, `404 Not Found`, `422 Unprocessable Entity`. 3. **RESTful Design** - Resource-based URLs (e.g., `/students/`). - Statelessness. --- #### **F. Performance & Networking** 1. **Bandwidth Calculations** - **Formula:** ``` Time (seconds) = File Size (MB) × 8 / Speed (Mbps) ``` - **Example:** 10 MB file at 5 Mbps → `10 × 8 / 5 = 16` seconds. --- #### **G. Usability & UX** 1. **Nielsen’s Heuristics** - **Visibility of system status:** Always inform users (e.g., error messages). - **Example Violation:** Login form with no feedback on wrong credentials. --- #### **H. Logging** 1. **Python Logging Levels** - `DEBUG` (10), `INFO` (20), `WARNING` (30), `ERROR` (40), `CRITICAL` (50). - **Example:** ```python logging.basicConfig(level=logging.WARNING) logging.error("This will appear") logging.info("This will NOT appear") ``` --- --- ### **2. Key Equations (Math/Performance)** | **Concept** | **Equation** | **Example** | |---------------------------|---------------------------------------|--------------------------------------| | Bandwidth Time Calculation | `Time = (File Size × 8) / Speed` | 10 MB at 5 Mbps → 16 seconds | | Modulo Operation | `a % b` | `4 % 5 = 4` | | Grade Calculation | `if marks >= 90: grade = "A"` | `88 → "B"` | --- --- ### **3. Mermaid Knowledge Graphs** #### **Graph 1: Flask Core Concepts** ```mermaid graph TD A[Flask] --> B[Routing] A --> C[Templates] A --> D[Request Handling] A --> E[Database] A --> F[Error Handling] B --> B1[@app.route] B --> B2[Dynamic URLs] C --> C1[Jinja2 Syntax] C --> C2[Template Inheritance] D --> D1[Query Params] D --> D2[Form Data] E --> E1[SQLAlchemy ORM] E --> E2[Relationships] F --> F1[abort()] F --> F2[Custom Error Pages] ``` #### **Graph 2: Git Workflow** ```mermaid graph LR A[Local Changes] --> B[git add] B --> C[git commit] C --> D[git pull] D --> E[git push] E -->|Conflict| D ``` #### **Graph 3: Testing Hierarchy** ```mermaid graph TD A[Testing] --> B[Unit Tests] A --> C[Integration Tests] A --> D[System Tests] B --> B1[pytest] B --> B2[Fixtures] C --> C1[Flask Client] D --> D1[User Acceptance] ``` #### **Graph 4: HTTP Methods & Status Codes** ```mermaid graph LR A[HTTP Methods] --> B[GET] A --> C[POST] A --> D[PUT] A --> E[DELETE] B --> B1[200 OK] B --> B2[404 Not Found] C --> C1[201 Created] C --> C2[400 Bad Request] ``` #### **Graph 5: Frontend Technologies** ```mermaid graph TD A[Frontend] --> B[HTML] A --> C[CSS] A --> D[JavaScript] B --> B1[Block Elements] B --> B2[Inline Elements] C --> C1[Selectors] C --> C2[Box Model] D --> D1[DOM Manipulation] D --> D2[Events] ``` #### **Graph 6: Database Relationships (SQLAlchemy)** ```mermaid graph LR A[Author] -->|One-to-Many| B[Book] A -->|cascade=delete| B B -->|ForeignKey| A B -->|backref| A ``` --- --- ### **4. Exam Tips** 1. **Flask:** - Remember that `lazy='dynamic'` returns a **query object**, not loaded data. - Trailing slashes in routes redirect automatically (e.g., `/about` → `/about/`). - `request.args` is for `GET`; `request.form` is for `POST`. 2. **Git:** - Always `pull` before `push` to avoid conflicts. - Merge sequence: `git checkout main; git merge feature-branch`. 3. **Testing:** - pytest requires test functions to start with `test_`. - Use `-m` to run marked tests (e.g., `pytest -m unit`). 4. **HTTP:** - `GET` exposes data in URLs; avoid for sensitive data. - `422` = Unprocessable Entity (validation errors). 5. **Frontend:** - `
` is block-level; `` is inline. - Use `style.fontWeight = "bold"` (not `style="bold"`). 6. **Performance:** - **1 MB = 8 Mb** (1 Byte = 8 bits). - Time = (File Size in MB × 8) / Speed in Mbps. 7. **Logging:** - `logging.basicConfig(level=logging.WARNING)` hides `INFO`/`DEBUG`. 8. **Jinja2:** - Extends must wrap content in `{% block %}`. --- --- ### **5. Common Pitfalls** - **Flask Templates:** Forgetting to place content inside `{% block %}`. - **SQLAlchemy:** Confusing `lazy='dynamic'` with eager loading. - **Git:** Pushing without pulling first (causes conflicts). - **HTTP:** Using `GET` for passwords (exposed in URLs). - **Testing:** Not marking tests properly (e.g., `@pytest.mark.unit`).
